page.title: 03MACKEREL FISHING,ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Due to the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries' ban on herring catches, interest turned to mackerel fishing as carried out by East European boats fishing off the British Western seaboard,prior to the 200 mile European Economic Communities'(EEC) fishing limit.Their catches were for their home market and certain African nations. In 1978 a Bulgarian factoryship fleet came to Ullapool because of the safe, all-weather anchorage and convenience to fishing grounds. This led to a modern day version of the herring-klondyking operations. The 1100 different foreign factoryships (1000 to 16000t.) have anchored in Loch Broom and about 170 vessels from Rumania,Bulgaria,Soviet Union,E.Germany,Poland,Italy,Ghana, Egypt and France came in one season.
